Key Match Events: David Brooks scored the opening goal in the 3rd minute with a leaping header after Harry Wilson's shot was saved.
Neco Williams made it 2-0 with a powerful strike in the 38th minute from a backheeled free kick by Wilson.
Teemu Pukki scored Finland's first goal on the stroke of halftime, his 40th international goal.
Brennan Johnson extended the lead with a close-range finish in the 47th minute after Ethan Ampadu's header.
Ben Davies' fourth goal was ruled out by VAR in the 79th minute.
Dan James scored the fourth goal in the 86th minute with a solo effort after dribbling past Lukas Hradecky.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales manager Rob Page expressed confidence in the team's performance and highlighted Dan James' contribution.
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page praised the team's effort and emphasized the importance of the upcoming match against Poland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Cardiff City Stadium with an attendance of 32,162.
Wales qualified for the 2024 European Championship after this victory.
